properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong easterly winds gusting up to 90 km/h are expected this evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-20T07:59:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-19T19:09:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2798642441.2019
Area: Puvirnituq, Inukjuak
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. A line of thunderstorms is developing along the Quebec/Maine border and will track eastward this evening over western New Brunswick. The threat for severe thunderstorms may continue into the late evening. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-20T04:59:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-19T18:36:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1831360506.2019
Area: Fredericton and Southern York County, Woodstock and Carleton County, Edmundston and Madawaska County, Grand Falls and Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, heavy at times is expected. Heavy rain and strong winds continuing over Arviat and ending Tuesday morning. A slow moving low pressure system over Hudson Bay will continue to bring heavy rain and strong northeast winds to southern Kivalliq. As of 1:00 pm Monday 29 mm of rain had already fallen overnight. Total rainfall amounts will range between 35-50 mm by Tuesday morning before the rainfall starts to taper off. Northeasterly winds, gusting at times to 70 km/h, will moderate Tuesday. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-20T12:07:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-19T20:08:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3666377322.2019
Area: Arviat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are no longer favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms. ###
Expires: 2019-08-19T23:18:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-19T22:18:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2396954964.2019

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times. ### Proceed with caution as visibility may suddenly be reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-08-20T01:59:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-19T22:26:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2301024195.2019
Area: L'Isle-aux-Coudres to Tadoussac, Beauport to L'Isle-aux-Coudres
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Rain will begin this afternoon as a slow moving trough of low pressure approaches Haida Gwaii. Rainfall amounts up to 50 mm can be expected by early Tuesday evening before the rain eases. Additionally, southeast winds 60 to 80 km/h will develop Tuesday morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-20T09:58:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-19T17:59:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1190967896.2019
Area: Haida Gwaii
properties.Author: Environment Canada
